items.title: Holiday Lull Weighs on Natural Gas Despite Seasonal Demand Optimism
items.summary: January natural gas futures edged lower in thin pre-Christmas trading, with liquidity and attention shifting to the February contract, which also moved lower ahead of its roll into the front-month position on Monday.

items.title: Old Man Winter on the Clock as Natural Gas Forward Prices Post Front-Weighted Gains
items.summary: Winter natural gas forward pricing strengthened modestly during the Dec. 17-23 trading period as forecasts added some heating demand to a still unseasonably mild weather outlook.

items.title: Alaska LNG Secures All Federal Permitting as Development Push Continues
items.summary: Glenfarne Group LLC, backer of the revived Alaska LNG project, has received the necessary federal permits and is working to attract customers to make the export facility a reality.

items.title: UK’s Harbour Snapping up LLOG, Securing U.S. Deepwater Natural Gas, Oil Footprint
items.summary: London-based Harbour Energy plc has agreed to pay $3.2 billion in a cash-and-stock deal to buy Louisiana-based LLOG Exploration Co. LLC, which focuses on natural gas and oil production in the Gulf Coast’s offshore.

items.title: Japex Grows U.S. Footprint in Verdad Deal, Aims to Acquire More Natural Gas Assets
items.summary: Japan Petroleum and Exploration Co. (Japex) said Thursday it would acquire Denver-Julesburg (DJ) Basin pure-play Verdad Resources Intermediate Holdings LLC for $1.3 billion.

items.title: Holiday Hangover Hits Natural Gas Futures After Largest One-Day Rally in Three Years
items.summary: After posting their biggest one-day gain in three years on thin trading volume, January natural gas futures pulled back early Wednesday, the final trading day of the shortened Christmas week and ahead of Monday’s expiration.

items.title: Western Natural Gas Prices Plummet as Bidweek Trading Kicks Off
items.summary: January baseload natural gas prices weakened considerably during the first day of bidweek trading at various hubs across western North America, as healthy supplies and mild weather assuaged winter supply concerns.

items.title: All I Want for Christmas Is Cold: Forecasts Deliver as Natural Gas Futures Leap Higher
items.summary: January natural gas futures ripped higher Tuesday, logging their biggest daily gain in three years as colder weather forecasts collided with thinning holiday liquidity.

items.title: Ho Ho Holy Cow: Natural Gas Futures Surge Amid Lack of Fundamental Clarity Ahead of Christmas
items.summary: Cheered on by storage uncertainty heading into the Christmas holiday weekend and the January contract’s Monday expiration, bulls took the reins Tuesday, delivering a sharp rally in natural gas futures.

items.title: Oil Prices Climb Despite Oversupply Fears
items.summary: WTI crude futures advanced more than 3% during the final full trading week of 2025, rising to $58.46 after gaining $1.94 since last Friday. The rally stands out during a traditionally muted period between Christmas and New Year’s, when thin liquidity

items.title: Falling Exports and Unsold Cargoes Test Nigeria’s Oil Sector
items.summary: Where Are Nigeria’s Oil Exports Going? Nigeria’s crude exports outside of the country have fallen to their lowest reading in a year, averaging 1.2 million b/d this month to date, adversely affected by an explosion at the Escravos-Lagos pipeline earli

items.title: Venezuela’s Oil Exports Begin to Feel the Weight of Enforcement
items.summary: Politics, Geopolitics & Conflict U.S. actions around Venezuelan oil exports are now affecting actual flows. Chasing a third tanker in less than two weeks has made shippers more cautious and reduced the number of willing buyers. Loadings are slowing.

items.title: Oil Prices Hold Gains as Markets Focus on Supply Fears and Economic Strength
items.summary: Oil prices stabilized on Wednesday after a run of gains, with markets digesting U.S. economic strength and ongoing supply uncertainty tied to Venezuelan crude exports and the continued war between Russia and Ukraine. At the time of writing, Brent cru

items.title: California Gas May Soar Past $5 Per Gallon By 2026
items.summary: U.S. gasoline prices are set to fall to the lowest level since 2020, thanks to increasing supplies, despite some ongoing refinery maintenance, GasBuddy has predicted. GasBuddy has predicted that U.S. motorists will pay an average of $2.79 per gallon

items.title: Iraq Becomes a Battleground for China and Western Oil Giants
items.summary: Iraq is at a crucial tipping point in its history. The past few months especially have seen a surge in activity from Western firms looking to re-enter the country’s oil and gas sector following a prolonged hiatus that had allowed the previous build-u
